DOC.brief_title: Training Parenting Self-efficacy Parents Hospitalized Preterm Neonates
DOC.detailed_description: Longitudinal , prospective , analytic cohort study parent preterm newborn receive specific train program caring preterm newborn hospitalization . Families recruit first 10 day hospitalization . The PMP S-E ( Perceived Maternal Parenting Self- Efficacy ) tool develop Barnes Adamson-Macedo , use measure self-efficacy providing infant care mother mother father . The training program develop bed side nurse neonatologist cover theoretical practical session first 25 day hospitalization . Hypothesis principal : Parents hospitalize preterm neonate get good score application specific train program ( CAP-PREM ) . Secondary hypothesis : - There correlation level stress anxiety parent admission discharge result PMP S-E score CAP-PREM program - To assess select demographic variable predict good result PMP S-E score CAP-PREM program
DOC.criteria: Preterm infants 25 32 week gestation , parent stay unit least 8 hours/day train program fluent Spanish . parent age > 18 year No clinical instability , invasive mechanical ventilation , intraventricular hemorrhage > II necrotizing enterocolitis . congenital malformation chromosomal abnormality Exclusion criterion : No possibility survival beyond first week life Admission le 4 week No collaboration / lack parental compliance wish parent leave study
